text: {"grade": 0, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to recommend obtaining an Advance Tariff Ruling (ATR) from HMRC for the Alpine model due to its novel refrigerant. The candidate answer recommends submitting a BTI (Binding Tariff Information) application, which is the correct mechanism for obtaining a binding classification ruling from HMRC. While BTI and ATR are often used interchangeably in common parlance, BTI is the specific, formal application under UK customs law for binding tariff classification. Since the candidate explicitly names the correct procedure (BTI) which serves the exact function described in the criterion (obtaining a binding classification ruling from HMRC), it satisfies the intent of the criterion.", "criterion_id": "a07478e0-ab1f-4244-81e1-6ce4bbf8d0c5"}
